entry.title: How to Handle Posting Issues for Billing Documents Using Joule
entry.content:
Background Information

As a billing clerk, managing billing documents with posting issues can be frustrating sometime. Fortunately, Joule can streamline the process, making it more efficient and less stressful to resolves the posting issues. 

Posting issues often arise when billing documents cannot be posted to the financial account due to errors like closed posting periods. Common errors include accounting errors (F5/286 and F5/903), which occur when the billing date falls outside the open period.

Joule is an AI copilot designed to enhance interaction with SAP business systems. Joule delivers a unified user experience across SAP's solutions, offering conversational interactions to streamline information access, automate business processes, and improve both employee and customer satisfaction. For more information, see What Is Joule.

Prerequisites

  1. Ensure you have the Sales - Billing Documents business catalog (SAP_SD_BC_BIL_DOC_PC) assigned. The Billing Clerk role template (SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK) includes this catalog by default. 
  2. Set up Joule in your environment. For more information, see Initial Setup. 

Implementation Details

Follow the steps below to try out this feature:

  1. Log in to your Fiori Launchpad as a Billing Clerk. 
  2. Launch Joule. The method for launching Joule differs depending on your platform. See Using Joule | SAP Help Portal.
  3. Ask Joule to find out billing documents with posting issues. You can narrow down your searching results by specifying criteria such as document type, issue type, or sales organization. Note that only the billing documents with accounting access error will be listed here.
  4. Use the Post button or chat commands to post a document. Only one document can be posted at a time.
  5. Review the error message for more details.
  6. As an alternative solution, you can adjust the billing date to a valid date using the quick buttons. When the posting error is resolved, the document will be automatically posted. You can open the billing document to confirm the changes.

By following these steps, you can efficiently manage and resolve posting issues, ensuring a smooth billing process. 

Watch the following video for step-by-step instruction:

entry.title: From Data to Delight‚ÄîHow SAP CX AI Toolkit Transforms Customer Experiences
entry.content:
Introduction
As customer‚Äôs needs evolve at lightning speed, it‚Äôs more important than ever for businesses to truly tap into their data and unlock new possibilities to stay one step ahead. The SAP CX AI Toolkit is revolutionizing how organizations automate, streamline, and enhance customer interactions. By blending next-generation AI with advanced data analytics, the toolkit accelerates productivity and reveals actionable insights across sales, service, and commerce domains. Additionally, Joule‚Äîthe integrated AI copilot‚Äîoffers a seamless interface for accessing all the toolkit‚Äôs power.

Why SAP CX AI Toolkit?

SAP CX AI Toolkit bridges operational silos, bringing together CRM, email, and business systems to create efficient, role-specific workflows. With Generative AI features, it streamlines repetitive tasks, delivers proactive business intelligence, and empowers your teams to make smarter decisions‚Äîsaving you hours and driving tangible results.

Key Benefits

  • Informed Decisions: Combine enterprise and operational data to empower intelligent, data-driven choices.
  • Automated Tasks: Eliminate manual effort by automating routine actions within your team‚Äôs existing workspace‚Äîwhether in a dedicated app or through Joule.
  • Faster Customer Response: Quickly understand customer needs and respond with timely, AI-powered insights derived from comprehensive enterprise data.

Comprehensive Features & Highlights

  1. Role-Specific AI Tools
    The toolkit delivers specialized AI capabilities tailored to vital CX roles:
  • Customer communication automation
  • Summarization of records and meetings
  • Object and image recognition
  • Contextual prompts for sales, service, and marketing
    These tools enable every team to work faster and smarter.
  1. Robust Data Protection
    With best-in-class personal data protection and zero data retention policies, SAP CX AI Toolkit ensures your sensitive enterprise information remains secure and compliant.
  2. Multi-Source Data Integration
    Aggregate and analyze data from diverse systems‚ÄîSales, Service, Commerce, CDP, Microsoft 365‚Äîand unlock insights across every customer touchpoint.
  3. Configurable Tools
    From data sources to generative templates and prompts, every element is tailored to your organization‚Äôs needs, allowing a customized CX automation strategy.

Persona-Based Licensing
SAP CX AI Toolkit‚Äôs functionality is organized around three distinct licenses‚Äîusable individually or combined, based on your operational persona:

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2
  • SAP Service Cloud Version 2
  • SAP Commerce Cloud

Each license unlocks targeted features:

License Type

Key Tools & Features

All Licenses

Intelligent Q&A, Smart Actions, Meetings, Scheduling

Sales Cloud V2

Opportunity Summarization, Prospecting Emails, Discovery Call Questions

Service Cloud V2

Case Overview, Customer Service Responses, Knowledge Base Article Creation

Combined Licenses

Meeting Summaries, Follow-up Emails, Account Overviews

Commerce Cloud

Product Attributes, Descriptions, Image Generation, Visual Search, Blog & Social Posts

 

User Interfaces: Accessing SAP CX AI Toolkit
The toolkit is flexibly accessible through several user interfaces:

  • Web App: Log in using SAP or Microsoft credentials to set up your tenant and access tools as per your license. The web app features an intuitive dashboard, a searchable Q&A bar, customizable AI panels, real-time notifications, and process monitoring.
  • Chrome Extension (Joule): Installable from the Chrome Web Store, Joule places AI functionality at your fingertips across business applications like Outlook Web, SAP Cloud for Customer, and SAP Commerce Cloud. Features are context-aware and can be accessed directly as a browser overlay.
  • Embedded Panel: Integrated into SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 as a right-side panel, delivering the full web app experience in-context with contact, account, case, and opportunity data.

In-depth Feature Exploration

Intelligent Q&A
Leverages Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to provide precise, natural-language answers to work-related questions by drawing from your enterprise sources‚Äîemails, meeting transcripts, documents, service tickets, product specs, and more. Data privacy is built-in, with no personal data stored in AI models.

Generative AI Tools
Adapted for three core ecosystems, these tools automate:

  • Microsoft 365: Meeting summaries and follow-up emails
  • SAP C4C, Sales & Service Cloud V2: Account/Opportunity summaries, prospecting emails, case overviews, customer service responses, knowledge base articles, discovery call questions
  • SAP Commerce Cloud: Blog/social media post generation, product banner text, ATP inquiries, product review summaries

SAP Commerce Cloud Features

  • AI Product Tagging: Automatically generate and enrich product attributes.
  • Product Description Generation: Create and translate compelling catalog and marketing texts.
  • Product Image Generation: Enhance images, add overlays, and edit visuals.
  • Visual Search: Find catalog products using user-uploaded images‚Äîtransforming discovery and search.

AI Tools Builder & Agents
Customize the toolkit with AI tools and intelligent agents tailored to your business needs, such as service classification, knowledge base article generation, shopping advice, quote automation, and catalog optimization.

Persona-Based Use Cases

Sales Cloud V2:

  • Combine emails, chats, and sales data for rich insights
  • Generate dynamic content for effective sales outreach
  • Quick, trustworthy answers and efficient interaction summaries
  • Personalized prospecting emails and targeted follow-up actions

Service Cloud V2:

  • Streamline case management and service responses
  • Auto-generate knowledge base content
  • Leverage smart scheduling and notifications for efficient service delivery

Commerce Cloud:

  • Enrich product content and images with AI
  • Automate catalog descriptions and visual searching
  • Drive engagement through AI-powered blog and social posts

Custom AI Tool API Support

The SAP CX AI Toolkit also empowers developers with Custom AI Tool API Support‚Äîa set of Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that enable seamless integration of advanced, tailor-made Artificial Intelligence solutions within external applications. This means organizations can extend AI-driven outcomes to new business scenarios, connecting their unique workflows and data landscapes with the intelligence of SAP CX AI Toolkit agents.

Smarter Customer Engagement with AI Agents

SAP CX AI Toolkit features AI agents‚ÄîShopping Agent and Digital Service Agent‚Äîeach designed to address distinct phases of the customer journey.

Shopping Agent: Your Digital Sales Associate

The Shopping Agent transforms your commerce storefront by engaging customers through natural language conversations. Acting as a knowledgeable digital associate, it understands everything from specific requests‚Äîsuch as ‚ÄúI need a lightweight rain jacket‚Äù‚Äîto broader needs like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm planning a beach vacation.‚Äù The agent instantly provides tailored responses, including details about product features, compatibility, and recommendations.

Configuration is flexible, you can integrate the Shopping Agent directly into your online catalog using SAP CX AI Toolkit, and the agent converses in the customer‚Äôs language. Purpose-built for both B2B and B2C scenarios (activated via API configuration), the Shopping Agent proactively interacts with customers, refining product suggestions through relevant follow-up questions and guiding them throughout their shopping experience.

Key Capabilities of the Shopping Agent include:

  • Helping customers find and compare products using conversational AI.
  • Understanding and processing complex customer queries through intuitive dialogue.
  • Integrating seamlessly with your e-commerce storefront via a robust, flexible API.

Knowledge Base Integration:
The Shopping Agent can process unstructured data in varied formats as part of its knowledge base. By uploading product manuals, catalogs, or specification documents (PDF, image, text, spreadsheet formats, etc.) to SAP Commerce Cloud, you arm the agent with deep, detailed product knowledge to answer nuanced customer queries.

Digital Service Agent: Intelligent Post-Purchase Support

The Digital Service Agent is designed to deliver top-tier, automated customer support in natural language. Leveraging specific business knowledge sources‚Äîconfigured by your administrator‚Äîit answers post-purchase inquiries, resolving common issues and freeing up your service team for escalated cases.

This agent can operate solo or alongside the Shopping Agent, providing unified and continuous support throughout a customer‚Äôs lifecycle. For example, after a purchase, a customer with a warranty question interacts with the Digital Service Agent, who pulls relevant information‚Äîeven translating responses if needed for multilingual scenarios.

Key Capabilities of the Digital Service Agent include:

  • Operating 24/7 to provide answers using precise business knowledge sources (manuals, FAQs, service tickets).
  • Handling service-related requests such as checking order status, processing returns, or addressing product issues.
  • Assisting in both B2B and B2C environments, with API-driven flexibility.

Comparison: Shopping Agent vs. Digital Service Agent

Feature

Shopping Agent (Digital Sales Associate)

Digital Service Agent (Customer Support)

Primary Goal

Drive sales, product discovery, pre-purchase assistance

Resolve service issues, post-purchase customer support

Key Functions

Recommends products; provides features/specs/compatibility info

Answers inquiries (warranties, returns, order status); FAQs

Data Sources

Product catalog & related documents/media

Knowledge base, service tickets, admin-configured sources

Integration

Direct commerce storefront integration

Standalone or in tandem with Shopping Agent

Focus

Product- and sales-oriented

Service- and resolution-oriented

 

In essence, the Shopping Agent is your digital sales expert, while the Digital Service Agent is your first-responder customer service assistant. Integrated together, they deliver a seamless, unified customer experience across all stages of the journey.

Conclusion
SAP CX AI Toolkit is more than a set of AI tools‚Äîit‚Äôs an innovation engine for your customer experience strategy. With deep integration, robust security, and persona-driven features, businesses can transform the way data is leveraged to create exceptional customer and employee experiences. Whether accessed via the web app, Chrome extension, or embedded panels, SAP CX AI Toolkit is ready to propel enterprises into the future of AI-powered customer interactions.

entry.title: From Legacy to AI-Powered: RISE Transformation Revolution with Joule for developers
entry.content:
Meet John: From ABAP Developer to AI-Powered Transformation Leader

Remember John? He started as a seasoned developer who was initially skeptical about AI assistance in ABAP development. His journey began with simple "quick questions" and real-time coding help through SAP Joule for Developers. Over the past months, we've watched John evolve from struggling with basic syntax queries to confidently generating complete Fiori Cloud applications using the OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard, implementing intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic, and seamlessly integrating external services through AI-powered OData consumption. What started as curiosity about AI-assisted coding has transformed John into his organization's go-to expert for next-generation ABAP development.

Now, John's mastery of ABAP AI development has reached new heights. From generating complete applications to implementing intelligent business logic, he's now tackling his organization's most complex challenge: transforming their legacy systems for SAP S/4HANA Cloud readiness. With the latest SAP Joule for Developers capabilities, what once seemed like an insurmountable migration project has become an intelligent, guided transformation journey.

The Transformation Challenge: From Legacy to S/4HANA Ready

John's organization faces a common but daunting reality: thousands of custom programs, reports, and interfaces built over 15 years need S/4HANA compatibility assessment and adaptation. Traditional approaches would require months of manual analysis, documentation diving, and painstaking code rewrites. But with the enhanced Custom Code Migration AI Assistant included in the latest Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities delivery for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition version 2025, John is revolutionizing how his team approaches this transformation. See here a demo.

Advanced Code Analysis with AI-Powered Intelligence

Documentation Chat: Instant Expert Knowledge

When John encounters complex S/4HANA simplification scenarios, he no longer spends hours searching through SAP Help or simplification SAP Notes and cookbooks. Using the /docs command in Joule chat, he directly queries SAP's comprehensive knowledge base:

"How does MATNR field length impact the code"

Instantly, Joule provides detailed explanations of technical field length changes and code adaptation requirements. The AI doesn't just return generic documentation, it contextualizes responses based on John's specific migration scenarios, highlighting the most relevant simplification items and their business impact.

The "Explain" Revolution: Understanding Legacy Code at Scale

John's team inherited a critical 700-line sales reporting program with no documentation. Previously, understanding such code would take days of analysis. Now, using the enhanced "Explain" functionality, John selects the entire program and asks Joule to break it down.

The AI provides comprehensive insights into:

  • Business Purpose: Explanation of what the program accomplishes with the possibility to ask for deep dive.
  • Processing Logic: Step-by-step breakdown of the program flow also with the possibility to ask for detailed insights
  • Data Dependencies: Identification of tables, views, and external interfaces

Intelligent Issue Resolution with ATC Findings Analysis

Beyond Error Detection: AI-Powered Problem Solving

When John runs ATC checks with S/4HANA readiness variants, traditional tools simply flag issues. The new "Explain ATC Findings" capability transforms error messages into actionable intelligence.

For a critical database operation issue‚Äî"S/4HANA Database Operation: DELETE on FAGLFLEXA05"‚ÄîJoule doesn't just identify the problem. It provides:

  1. Root Cause Analysis: "FAGLFLEXA05 appears to be a General Ledger line item table that has been affected by S/4HANA's simplified finance model"
  2. Business Impact: Explanation of why this change matters for financial reporting
  3. Resolution Strategy: Step-by-step guidance using recommended SAP APIs
  4. Code Examples: Practical ABAP snippets showing the correct implementation approach

  

Proactive Code Adaptation Proposals

The upcoming code proposal functionality, planed for Q1 2026 will take John's transformation journey even further. Instead of just explaining issues, Joule will generate complete, S/4HANA-ready code adaptations. John can preview proposed changes, understand their impact, and implement solutions with confidence.

 

The Complete Transformation Ecosystem

John's workflow now encompasses the entire legacy-to-cloud transformation lifecycle:

  • Analysis Phase (Released): Documentation chat provides instant access to S/4HANA knowledge 
  • Understanding Phase (Released): Explain functionality reveals legacy code business logic and technical dependencies
  • Assessment Phase (Released): ATC findings explanation transforms error lists into strategic migration roadmaps 
  • Adaptation Phase (Planned): Code proposals deliver ready-to-implement S/4HANA compatible solutions

Real-World Impact: Transformation at Enterprise Scale

"Six months ago, analyzing a single custom program took our team days," John reports to his CTO. "Today, I can understand complex legacy code in minutes, get detailed S/4HANA compatibility analysis instantly, and receive step-by-step resolution guidance for every issue. The productivity gain is incredible."

The quantifiable benefits are remarkable:

  • Analysis Time: Reduced from days to hours per program
  • Documentation Research: From days to minutes for complex scenarios
  • Error Resolution: From trial-and-error to guided, intelligent solutions
  • Code Quality: AI-generated adaptations follow SAP best practices automatically

Accelerating SAP Transformation with Enhanced Custom Code Migration Analysis

Listening to the TechEd announcement John is excited to learn about the significant enhancement of Custom Code Migration Application, built on SAP BTP ABAP Environment (Steampunk), scheduled for Q1 next year. This powerful application will incorporate advanced legacy code explain and ATC explain capabilities, providing project managers and functional consultants with unprecedented visibility into their SAP transformation journey. The Custom Code Migration Application seamlessly connects to any legacy SAP ERP On-Premise system, enabling comprehensive migration analysis that goes beyond surface-level assessments to deliver deep, contextual insights into custom code behavior and business logic.

Looking ahead, the roadmap includes two additional game-changing use cases that will further streamline your S/4HANA transformation. The Fit-to-Standard Analysis feature will intelligently evaluate whether existing custom developments are now covered by native S/4HANA Private Cloud functionality, providing clear recommendations on which customizations can be retired or simplified. Complementing this, our Clean Core Recommender will proactively identify deviations from SAP's clean core best practices and deliver actionable guidance to align your system architecture with modern standards. Together, these capabilities will empower organizations to make informed decisions about their custom code portfolio while ensuring a future-ready, maintainable SAP landscape that maximizes the value of their S/4HANA investment.

 Looking Forward: The Hybrid AI Service Revolution

The promise of SAP's revolutionary side-by-side ABAP AI service represents the next transformation frontier. This groundbreaking approach will bring cutting-edge AI capabilities to older SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition releases, eliminating the wait for upgrades while accelerating innovation across hybrid landscapes.

John's journey from struggling with ABAP syntax to leading enterprise-scale S/4HANA transformations demonstrates the profound impact of AI-assisted development. With each new capability, the boundary between complex legacy challenges and intelligent, automated solutions continues to blur.

Ready to transform your legacy landscape? Explore the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant capabilities and discover how natural language conversations can revolutionize your S/4HANA journey.

 

The ABAP AI revolution continues to evolve‚Äîand John's story is just beginning. Stay tuned for the next chapter as we unveil the hybrid AI service innovations that will redefine enterprise development across every SAP landscape.

entry.title: Understanding Shadow AI and Its Impact on Data Security
entry.content:
Hi community! This is my second post here, and I wanted to share a topic that keeps coming up in conversations with many IT leaders lately: Shadow AI. 

We‚Äôve all noticed how quickly AI tools have found their way into our daily routines. It often starts with small things: someone uses ChatGPT to summarize a meeting, another person drafts a report with Gemini, or a colleague asks an AI tool to polish a sales email. Most of the time, these actions come from curiosity or a genuine wish to save time and work better. 

But sometimes, we might be introducing risk when using these tools without IT oversight. 

A recent example that caught my attention came from the legal world. Some in-house lawyers at large companies were using public AI tools to draft contracts or analyze documents. One case described a lawyer uploading confidential merger files into a personal account just to meet a deadline. It sounds extreme, but it happens more often than we think... 

Of course, people don‚Äôt intend to break the rules or do something dangerous. They just want to get things done faster. Still, when you use an AI tool without reading its data policies first, you might be exposing sensitive information or allowing it to be used for unintended purposes. Once that data leaves the company‚Äôs ecosystem, no one can fully control where it goes or how it‚Äôs handled. 

This is what many are calling Shadow AI. It‚Äôs the evolution of Shadow IT. Years ago, employees installed their own software or used unapproved SaaS apps to get their work done. Now, it‚Äôs large language models quietly spreading across teams without IT even knowing. 

Why does it happen? Usually, as I mentioned, it‚Äôs simply because people want to be more efficient. When official tools are too limited or slow, they look for alternatives that help them. 

That‚Äôs why I believe the solution isn‚Äôt to block AI, but to guide its use. When enterprises make AI available inside secure environments like SAP, people can use it safely and productively at the same time. 

Imagine a legal department using AI built into their SAP environment to review contracts or summarize long documents. The team saves time, but everything stays within the company‚Äôs governance and data protection rules. The same idea applies to finance teams running forecasts or HR teams preparing reports. 

AI can help... as long as it happens in a trusted space. 

Shadow AI isn‚Äôt about people doing something wrong. It‚Äôs about people trying to do their best with the tools they have. The challenge for leaders is to give them the right environment to expermient. 

And that‚Äôs the beauty of it: SAP gives you a safe space to experiment with AI through its own suite of tools - Joule, BTP, and Datasphere. 

Thanks for reading! I‚Äôd love to know if you‚Äôve seen similar situations in your teams, or how your organization is balancing innovation and data protection.

entry.title: SAP Ariba, SAP Fieldglass and SAP S/4HANA ERP solutions for public healthcare
entry.content:
Author: Allan Soo

Introduction

Healthcare public sector procurement spend is among the largest across the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD). In 2021, 31.9% of all public procurement spend touches on public healthcare and infrastructure [1]. Nearly 75% of public spend on healthcare came from taxpayers [2]. With an ageing population and a shrinking taxpayer base, governments across the world are grappling with these fiscal challenges. One solution is to deploy effective spend management, procurement solutions across cost-intensive sectors of the economy to keep costs down.

Figure depicting the percentage government expenditure across the OECD-EU countries for 2023 [3]. Public sector procurement across the OECD-EU markets was 14.7% (2023), an increase of 0.9% compared to 2019.  

Why an effective, public procurement platform is crucial for public healthcare and governments?

Public procurement in healthcare is one of the most regulated forms of purchasing dealing with hospitals, pharmacies, and qualified suppliers. This requires complex compliance to purchasing pharmaceutical ingredients, chemicals and other regulated products to be compliant to public healthcare agencies. An example is the procurement of surgical implants and tools which must comply with the Therapeutic Goods Association (TGA) and other dangerous goods regulations.

Healthcare public procurement is becoming a significant challenge for governments worldwide due to factors such as an ageing population, rising deficits and total debts, the high costs of running healthcare facilities, and increased health and safety regulations.

Track spend and compliance across cost-intensive healthcare segments by different categories with SAP Ariba Category Management, SAP Ariba Intake Management and SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle Performance Management

SAP Ariba Category Management gives public sector healthcare purchasers the tools to track spend goals on their most cost-intensive areas of their agency including high-tech equipment, specialized hospital beds, pharmaceutical purchases and more.

The solution gives public healthcare purchasers the option to manage supplier performance and track these against budgets, manage funds and investments assigned and set to them by the government.

The solution also offers customers a 360-degree visibility into the supplier‚Äôs healthcare certifications and qualifications, making sure that they comply to directives and maximize compliance across all purchases made for the public facilities. For example, Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) license for Australia, Wholesale Distribution Authorisation for EU suppliers supplying medicinal products, and Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency certification for medicinal product manufacturing in the United Kingdom.

Adverse events can then be monitored using SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance Management to manage supplier risks appropriately. 3rd party data such as D&B can give government buyers additional intelligence on the market risk of that supplier such as sustainability, supply chain exposure, and aid in calculating inherent and residual risk scoring‚Ä¶and so on. Up to 25 custom risk scores can be applied to the healthcare supplier in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

Renegotiate and manage multiple quotes across healthcare suppliers to drive cost savings with finance

To keep costs down, buyers have the ability with SAP Ariba Sourcing and Procurement for Public Sector in SAP S/4HANA, to manage different quotes and renegotiate prices with existing suppliers to obtain better deals. For example, evaluating the procurement of multiple MRI and X-ray machines, and different existing drug prices to encourage better competition between pharmaceutical suppliers to drive down prices.

Buyers can take advantage of the SAP Taulia Private Cloud solution with SAP S/4HANA and Dynamic Discounting feature where fast, early account payable transactions towards suppliers can lead to discounted cash savings that yield improved bottom line benefits for public healthcare finance customers.

Connect SAP Ariba Sourcing and SAP Ariba Buying solutions to the SAP S/4HANA ERP for high-level spend management and monitoring

Go beyond purchasing and ordering with high-level dashboard spend visibility [4] to track the list of purchase orders with SAP Ariba Central Procurement with SAP Ariba Buying (3EN) and SAP Ariba Buying, with guided buying capabilities (2NV) into SAP S/4HANA. Easily track the process flow of your purchases and export accounting documents to SAP finance and accounting solutions. Use three-way matching against invoice, purchase order and goods receipt to ensure that cost information is accurate. Request quotes from suppliers, allocate budget and discuss on pricing terms.

One highly relevant area for this is the operational procurement of medical apparel, protective equipment, gloves and face masks. You as the buyer want the tools to negotiate with suppliers on favorable pricing terms, sort price lists in Catalogs available over the SAP Business Network, and see the list of purchase orders, invoices and goods receipts in one place. You can set estimated budgets throughout the quotation process and track how far below under the target price you are able to get the costs down to attain cost savings.

Figure showing SAP Ariba Buying and Invoicing solution where healthcare purchasers can track how far below taxpayer funded budget they can obtain when purchasing medical supplies like gloves.

With these solutions, healthcare public sector buyers and public finance can move away from matching for accuracies and scrutinize cost details on these items and work collaboratively with other departments to find alternative suppliers and products that offer cheaper and better-quality substitutes.  

Leverage AI solutions for contracts management

SAP Ariba Contract Intelligence by Icertis SolEx has contract authoring capabilities that are bolstered by AI to automate much of the clause generation that is in line with the public healthcare industry and to drive compliance. Examples can include authoring in sustainability criteria, medical manufacturing license requirements from suppliers, and assigning responsibilities on direct suppliers and their affiliates. By automating the contract lifecycle, lead times can be reduced and anomalies within contract clauses can be detected and flagged for risk mitigation. The solution helps users identify contract leakage risks to prevent cost blowouts and put boundaries on spend conditions for public healthcare purchases. Risk scores on suppliers can be imported from SAP Ariba Supplier Risk to SAP Ariba Contracts to guide contract awarding decisions so that risk-aware awarding decisions can be made. Managing suppliers is part of the public sector procurement responsibility to ensure that government healthcare agencies continue receiving the best outcomes for the budget they are given with the right contracts in place.

Put cost guardrails on healthcare goods and services procured

With WK value contracts [5] in SAP S/4HANA, SAP Ariba Contracts [6] users can set guardrails against overspending on suppliers. Given that in healthcare settings the quantity of goods can be non-negotiable, SAP Ariba Contracts offers the flexibility to adjust quantity (through quantity contracts) and assign other attributes such as discounts on purchased goods through supplier collaboration and negotiations. Buyers can set cost parameters on the value contracts and publish it through the Cloud Integration Gateway to SAP S/4HANA. Purchase cost data can then be ingested by finance solutions to monitor and act on the financial performance of the health agency.

Smart Peppol invoicing with SAP S/4HANA and SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

With eInvoicing solutions offered with SAP Documents and Reporting Compliance (cloud edition) within S/4HANA ERP Public Cloud Edition, SAP Business Network via SAP Integration Suite, and SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management - Peppol compliant documents can be exchanged to help government healthcare sectors align with eInvoicing compliance requirements or eliminate the use of physical paper. Eliminating physical paperwork and complying to Peppol eInvoicing means enhancing fraud-prevention systems in place to build trust with the public and install financial protections, improves productivity and minimizes errors in costing amounts.  Peppol is used by over 40 countries worldwide for business-to-government transactions, and is becoming a standardized, secure method of receiving invoices from the private sector supplier base by government agencies. Public hospitals and other healthcare agencies can examine and analyze invoice costs based on the high-fidelity information supplied electronically within the system, making it easily auditable for finance.

AI-driven Statement of Work (SOW) creations in SAP Fieldglass to alleviate workloads and focus on the things that matter

Minimize admin work and hire contractors to help comply to a variety of laws during the SOW creation process. Use the GenAI solution at SAP to identify opportunities to control costs during the SOW creation and reduce document creation times by about 71% by inputting titles, summaries and extracting data from PDF documents. With freed-up workloads, users can focus on the quality, risk and service traits of the contract (such as proper skills matching for best labour productivity outcomes). An example includes SOW creation for biohazardous health waste disposal services and scoping the boundaries of work, and clearly stating what services are in and out of scope and using SOW teams feature to collaborate with non-procurement colleagues on budget planning with finance that addresses high-spend service categories.

Improved SOW rates negotiation and cost management features on contracted services

Service buyers can negotiate for better rates post-agreement, automate offboarding signatures to cease spend, ensure hours worked are fulfilled by the contractors, reallocation of unspent SOW funds back to master SOW, inactivate cost centers when they are no longer used, and trigger alerts when rates vary away from agreed ones. These are features that are offered by SAP Fieldglass to service buyers in public healthcare settings to put a lid on costs.

Picture this, you need to onboard technicians to provide maintenance and calibration services for the complex equipment that the hospital has. Your rates need to be specified clearly, and any pay deviations need to be notified to the service buyer, clear start-end dates for the services and so on need to be in the SOW for legal reasons. You use the GenAI feature to produce an SOW quickly, double check the contents of this document, and have the work order issued. Skills are clearly specified for the job to minimize lead times onsite, and the best labour-hire is made. Therefore, costs are controlled, and the best productivity is obtained for maintenance work at the hospital.

Support green procurement practices

SAP Ariba Sourcing integrates with the suite of SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP sustainability solutions to drive green procurement practices across the public healthcare sector. Given that Scope 3 contributes to around 79% of total carbon emissions [7] for this sector across the OECD markets, governments can use SAP tools to drive sustainable procurement practices on their direct suppliers. Examples including procuring gloves with a low product carbon footprint, high recycled content, and rubber data to ensure that illegal deforestation has not contributed to its production.

Alongside SAP Ariba Supplier Management, SAP Fieldglass and SAP Ariba Contracts, public healthcare sectors can manage risk appropriately and enforce sustainability practices and compliance on suppliers and contractors. This includes due diligence screening solutions on a supplier‚Äôs human rights and deforestation records, having the right sustainability credentials, and embedding sustainability due diligence into the core operational and strategic sourcing processes from procurement to the ERP environment. Given the mandates that governments must meet for their own net-zero, human rights and material circularity directives - SAP Ariba, SAP Fieldglass and SAP ERP Sustainability solutions provide a comprehensive suite of products to drive decarbonization and compliance in the public healthcare space. Partner solutions on the SAP app store can be used to enrich supplier data with sustainability scores and other external intel.

Tap into the SAP Spend Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud solution for rich data reporting on procurement spend

Enrich healthcare spend data with other SAP Business Data Cloud products to gain deeper insights into the entire healthcare organization‚Äôs finance and spend data. SAP Spend Intelligence offers customers a large variety of data products it can ingest. For example, sustainability, risk, contract leakages and off-contract purchase order spend.  By providing strategic and operational insights into a public healthcare‚Äôs spend, buyers can optimize for and eliminate out non-compliance and uses AI and machine learning to automatically allocate spend categories neatly for interpretation. SAP Joule can be employed to clean and present cluttered data in a meaningful way that helps drive high-level decision-making processes which maximizes healthcare spend impacts and cuts down maverick and unwanted tail spend.

Conclusion

SAP Ariba, SAP Fieldglass and SAP S/4HANA ERP solutions provide finance and spend management solutions that offer customers the tools to keep up to date with the latest innovations in driving cost savings, optimize spend, manage down risks, reduce fraud and work collaboratively with public sector finance teams in government. Given the significance of public healthcare sectors across developed markets, innovative procurement spend management solutions play a key role in controlling costs in a high-expenditure industry. For years to come, healthcare expenses are projected to increase with an ageing population, rising deficits and living cost challenges.

This requires a comprehensive, suite of solutions for the public sector that leverages best-of-breed AI and solution offerings that advance the modernization of public sector procurement and finance operations. Governments have a responsibility to foster trust, comply to own directives, address fiscal challenges across the economy for the wellbeing of citizens, and deliver services cost-effectively to the public.

entry.title: Joule in SAP Build Code can now create freestyle UI5 apps
entry.content:
Last year, we introduced the SAPUI5 extension for the Joule coding assistant in SAP Build Code and wrote about how to use it. Over time, it has received more features, like the AI-supported conversion of UI5 apps to TypeScript and setting up new pages and the respective navigation.

The latest improvement, available from November 2025, lets you create new freestyle UI5 apps according to your requirements. The feature is not absolutely groundbreaking, as there are other tools doing a similar job like the Easy-UI5 templates and the recently published UI5 MCP Server. But:

  1. It brings the functionality right to the fingertips of developers using SAP Build Code‚Äîno other tools needed.
  2. It extends the template capabilities beyond what the Easy-UI5 templates provide.
  3. Implementing it within the Build Code Joule environment yielded interesting insights and further improvements. More on this in my other article.

 

The feature

Joule makes specific features available using "slash commands". The new one is /ui5-create-app. When you open the Joule panel in SAP Build Code and start typing /ui5, you might see it suggested, as well as other UI5 features. But which commands appear depends on the context. While some are only available within UI5 apps, this new feature is only available when you are not in a UI5 app. It won't be available e.g. in a workspace which has a ui5.yaml at top-level, or when you have a UI5 controller open in the code editor!

 

Try it in a workspace with a CAP project at root level, so you see some of its magic immediately: as soon as you finish typing the slash command or select it from the suggestion list, another suggestion list with sample prompts comes up. These are based on the actual data structures of the CAP project.

This means you can simply select the desired entity and service, then the actual full prompt will automatically be entered into the field(but of course you can also write your own prompt!). This full prompt includes even more details than the short prompt in the suggestion list did.

Note that the prompt includes a concrete list of properties and the service URL. This information has been extracted from CAP using good old deterministic code‚Äîno Large Language Model (LLM) used. In fact, this is an area where AI would likely make up ("hallucinate") property names which do not actually exist. Acquiring all this information in advance in a deterministic way not only gives you the chance to review and adjust the prompt with little effort, but also leads to a more reliable functionality overall.

The paradigm: use LLMs (Large Language Models) where they excel‚Äîprocessing and "understanding" language‚Äîand use deterministic code for hard facts and well-defined operations, where possible. 

The AI part starts soon enough, when you submit this prompt. It proposes a specific app setup, highlighting the key choices for you to review. For example, it will suggest a sensible name (if you didn't provide one) or suggest the best location inside the project structure (which it knows from its context).

But you can do more than just review those parameters. A suggested version of the app has already been created behind the scenes, so you can scroll through the 30+ files listed in the box at the bottom and click those you want to preview. If the result already looks fine to you‚Äîperfect. Just press the "Accept Application" button and the app will be set up in your workspace.

Refining the app

But of course you are free to continue the conversation and tweak the result. The LLM in Joule will put its true strength at work, mapping its understanding of your request to what the underlying template can do. No need to type "change parameter x to value y": LLMs also understand you when you are less formal and direct. Look at the below screenshot for an example: it responds almost too compassionately to the developer who is "hesitant about new technologies" and recreates the app with changed parameters‚Äîusing JavaScript instead of TypeScript. The user did not even mention the programming language specifically, but still the LLM decided that changing it would be the best way to accommodate the app code to the user's preferences.

At this stage, you can refine the setup of the initial app‚Äîwithin the limits imposed by the application template used behind the scenes, which only has limited degrees of freedom. We want this initial app to be robust and follow best-practice code. We also want those 30+ files to be created in one fast step. Hence the code is not written by AI, but by using predefined template files we are back in the world of traditional deterministic coding here. You have plenty of opportunity for using AI later on to extend the app from this solid starting point.

Joule is aware of its limits in this step, so it will not say "yes" to every request you throw at it. Asking for "a trillion tables" or other features beyond the template scope will be politely rejected.

Accepting the app

When the preview looks good and you have pressed the  button, the job of this /ui5-create-app assistant is done. After app setup has finished (which may take a while because the dependencies need to be installed), it concludes with hints how to continue, including instructions on how to start the app in your respective workspace setup.

The created application looks roughly like this, with a table and a detail form below. Note: only OData V4 services are supported at this time.

You get this kind of UI when you specify an OData V4 service and entity. If you don't, then there is just a generic "Hello World" success page instead.

Of course this UI structure might not be exactly what is desired in the app or even requested in the prompt, but this is what the template can do. When an OData service and entity but no properties are requested, then the tool tries to detect existing properties. If this fails, the table will be empty (no columns at all)‚Äîbut Joule's success message should then mention this.

After creation

As the assistant suggests, please move to the other Joule assistants /ui5 and /ui5-create-page for developing the app further. In order to create more apps, reset the conversation with the  button at the top of the Joule pane.

Because /ui5-create-app knows that it cannot modify the app or re-create it, it will politely guide you to the options you have, no matter what your request is. It may even give instructions on how to achieve the given goal within a UI5 app, but it will not be able to modify the code and it will make this clear when needed.

AI Learnings

While there is not much more to say about this feature‚Äîsimply try it!‚Äîthere are some facts and learnings about its implementation! If you are curious, head over to the second part of this blog post: Inside Joule: Lessons from building an AI coding assistant for SAP Build.

entry.title: Inside Joule: Lessons from building an AI coding assistant for SAP Build
entry.content:
Flashback: the feature

This is a "making of" article about the implementation of the new /ui5-create-app slash command available within Joule in SAP Build Code. In short, this new feature enables a conversation between AI assistant and application developer about a new freestyle UI5 application to build, with a full-fledged best-practice application starting point as result.

To see screenshots of this feature in action and understand it better, feel invited to read my previous blog post. If you are just here for the background and AI-related learnings‚Äîgo ahead!

 

General considerations

With open‚Äëended prompting, users aren‚Äôt restricted to predefined interactions. The user could ask for anything. In contrast to traditional programming, a prompt input field can‚Äôt be handled with a sprawling web of if/else logic trying to cover all possible use-cases. Attempting this will lead to a frustrating user experience where the user often gets an "I do not understand your request".

Some developers try to mimic this traditional programming pattern when crafting prompts and contexts for LLMs, telling an LLM "if the user asks for x, then answer y". Instead, as demonstrated below, tell the LLM what it can and cannot do and give it a goal to achieve. It's "smart" enough to figure out a suitable response to whatever the user will throw at it.

 

A fundamental choice

Looking at this specific feature in the specific environment, the implementation options on the table were (for a variety of reasons) these two:

  • Either just provide a system prompt (a prompt that is added behind the scenes in addition to what the user typed) without interfering with the specific prompts and replies entered during the conversation.
  • Or adopt a new way of creating an "agentic" multi-step execution plan. Similar to a guided activity, this would allow phases of data collection, possibly in different steps for different data, then an app creation step and so forth.

Surely "agentic" and "well-defined steps" sound good for app creation from a template, no? In fact, the initial implementation started like this, but it was soon apparent that this would neither provide the expected flexibility nor allow for a truly intelligent app creation experience. Defining phases in which to acquire specific information and having the application code created at a specific stage in this process did not feel right. The user would still feel like clicking through a traditional template creation process, as something specific was expected from the user at every stage, instead of giving the user the freedom to tweak every aspect at every stage. The true power of AI, on the other hand, would be totally underused.

But then again... just a system prompt and that's it? No file read access to explore the environment, no dynamically updated instructions? Is this enough for an intelligent coding assistant?

 

Creating an "AI agent" out of nothing

Consider the now common definition of an "AI agent" which has settled over the course of this year: it's nothing more than "an LLM with tools, called in a loop to achieve a goal". The chat conversation provided by Joule can be our loop, an application template with its parameters is the tool and the goal of assisting the developer to create an app can be stated in the system prompt. Of course a real autonomous agent would require the loop to run without user interaction, but for this feature a loop involving the user is just right.

The system prompt used for this feature literally includes: "You help users create new UI5 applications by analyzing their requirements and filling the project template parameters. [...] Your goal is to gather all necessary information to create a new UI5 application. The application will be generated from a template which has only one page and a hardcoded UI, but can optionally display data from an OData V4 service. [...] You cannot create the application yourself, but the user will see a preview...". There you have it: the goal and the tool!

It then goes on with some behavioral hints and of course a detailed description of what exactly the template parameters do. Finally, it requests each reply to contain a JSON object with the best choice of template parameters according to the current understanding of the user request. The JSON object could look like this example:

{

   "appNamespace": "com.myorg.myapp",

   "basePath": "/path/to/workspace",

   "createAppDirectory": true,

   "framework": "SAPUI5",

   "frameworkVersion": "1.136.0",

   "author": "John Doe",

   "oDataV4Url": "https://services.odata.org/TripPinRESTierService/(S(s5xrj1t51r41s3ooztsynysq))/",

   "oDataEntitySet": "Airports",

   "entityProperties": ["Name", "Address"],

   "runNpmInstall": true,

   "initializeGitRepository": true,

   "typescript": true

}

This JSON object is removed from the LLM response before displaying it, then the application is generated with these parameters, so the user can accept it or request changes. In an environment where tools with a well-defined interface like MCP servers are not enabled, this JSON object as part of the conversation is how the integration with the templating tool is achieved. It's basically a use-case-tailored alternative to MCP.  A note to make this very clear: this environment is not the official SAP Joule assistant running inside end-user applications, as it is now also being enabled for development by customers. Instead, it is a sort of predecessor implementation specifically available in SAP Build Code since spring 2024 and about to be replaced by advanced solutions. So do not draw conclusions about SAP Joule based on this article.

Some of these parameters in the JSON object are more important than others with regards to the user explicitly influencing them or having to accept them. Whether the app code is generated as TypeScript or JavaScript is something the user should not be surprised with after accepting the app! On the other hand, the author name, which is only written into package.json, can be reliably defaulted to the logged-in user name and also very easily changed later on if needed. Hence, the parameter descriptions explain not only what they do, but also how much the user should be bothered with them. As result, Joule usually does not even mention half of the parameters, thus keeping the conversation focused.

 

How to stop the agent

Regarding the state after the app was accepted, the prompt explains "AFTER the user has generated the application, you **MUST NOT** continue discussing parameters for generation, but rather [...] in particular by referring the user to the '/ui5' command for most requests or '/ui5-create-page' for adding pages to the app, because they are much better than you in developing features, as they have the capability to automatically select a suitable context of files.".

This means the transition in the overall process between refining parameters and "no more changes possible" is not a hardcoded step or denoted by changing the system prompt, but rather explained up-front. That's enough. Can you talk Joule into proposing another set of parameters after the app was accepted? Maybe. But its normal behavior is just right: it will explain that the app can not be created again without restarting the conversation. Nevertheless, there are also non-AI guardrails in place to prevent the app from being generated again, thus causing trouble.

All in all, we shape Joule‚Äôs behavior by explaining the templating tool and its limits, by stating the goal and desired behavior towards this goal, and by explaining the general flow, in particular the state after app acceptance. This is enough to guide it to a suitable reaction for whatever the user requests.

Even if the user insists like this:

 

Context, context, context!

To make the entire feature really user-friendly, however, it is not sufficient to write a good prompt, but the context must also provide enough information to the LLM to allow for informed decisions. Hence, information like the list of project root files and folders, whether a Git repository is present, plus CAP service/entity/property info, and more, are gathered (e.g. using the @sap-ux/project-access package). This knowledge is provided as prompt context behind the scenes or used in another way (like as content of the suggested prompts). This makes Joule aware of the environment it acts in, leading to better responses, like automatically avoiding app names that would conflict with existing folder names.

Agentic coding assistants like Cline, GitHub Copilot, Cursor etc. usually have the ability to read files and execute shell commands as needed to understand their environment. In this pure user request + LLM response environment this might have been a bit harder to build. Basically, more tools could have been defined, e.g. by describing other JSON object structures for invoking them. But control would not so easily return to the LLM until after the user has entered another prompt. Or, there could have been one "preprocessor" LLM request asking for needed files, like it is done for the other /ui5* commands.

But for a narrow scenario like app creation this wasn't necessary. Collecting the most relevant information up front not only provides sufficient context, but also improves performance and reliability by avoiding repeated tool calls and unpredictable LLM loops.

 

In-response prompting

The real-world context, however, changes over time. Specifically, once the app is created and accepted, there are new additional files present.

When developing the UI5 MCP server, we observed that the agentic AI tool (e.g. Cline) using the MCP server often decided to inspect the new app directory tree after creation, causing several LLM roundtrips which cost time and tokens. Or it would run "npm install" again, even though it had already been executed. Or it would make specific coding errors very often in subsequent modifications.

To avoid this, we extended the response of the MCP server after creating the app. Normally, it contains just the success message. But now it includes a full list of generated files, it states that "npm install" was already executed and it instructs how to prevent those coding errors. Basically, the MCP server response added further updated instructions to the conversation context.

Exactly the same principle was applied in this new Joule feature. While there is no autonomous agent loop in this case which would inspect the new files, the knowledge which files were created can be valuable for the conversation with the user. And while the/ui5-create-app command doesn't modify any code after app creation (thus avoiding the coding issues), facts like whether "npm install" was already executed, or whether the created UI5 Table in the MainView is lacking any columns, are useful for giving the user hints how to continue. Therefore, the context is extended by adding a hidden message to the conversation history.

 

Traditional coding has its place(s)

In addition to the process of context collection, deterministic coding is also used after the app has been accepted by the user for making the app consumption as smooth as possible. When inside a CAP project, it for example ensures that the cds-plugin-ui5 is added as dependency. This allows the UI5 tooling, including TypeScript transpilation of the UI5 app when needed, to run as part of the "cds watch" or "npm start" script of the CAP project itself.
 
Also, this dependency and all the UI5 app dependencies need to be installed. Unfortunately, there is a wide range of options and specific setups which might be used for dependency management in the already existing app. Probably npm? With or without workspaces? yarn? pnpm? Others? The code detects what is used and tries to cover the 95% case. The initial setup might not be complete in every scenario, but for most users it will ‚Äújust work,‚Äù providing a good developer experience.
AI is fine and all, but sometimes one has to go the extra mile and do some coding.
 

Key takeaways

  • Use deterministic code where reasonable (because the space of possibilities is bounded and a deterministic and quick result is beneficial) .
  • Use LLMs for language understanding or dealing with an unpredictable range of possible requests.
  • Don't try to "program" the LLM with an if/else prompt, but treat it like an intelligent human: state the goal, options and boundaries‚Äîand let it decide on its own.
  • Provide solid pre-collected context so the LLM can make good decisions reliably.

 

P.S.:

For those who prefer graphics over text to gain an understanding of something, here is a depiction of the overall information flow inside this feature.

entry.title: Unlock Base AI Package for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud ‚Äì Enjoy Joule and Embedded AI Features for Free
entry.content:
With the release of version 2508, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is taking a significant leap forward in enhancing user experience by offering Joule and Embedded AI features as part of its Base AI package.

These features are designed to streamline daily operations and provide a more intuitive interaction with your ERP system‚Äîall come at NO additional cost. They can be easily activated through the Base AI package or are already included in your standard cloud subscription, providing unrestricted access without the need for additional AI unit purchases.

Here's what you need to know about the scope of these AI features, along with guidance on how to activate them and set them up in your system.

 

Joule Base AI Features

Meet Joule, your all-in-one AI co-pilot in the SAP ecosystem, designed to simplify your work processes by providing an intuitive, personalized, and smart user experience. With skills and capabilities that cover a wide array of tasks, Joule supports approximately 80% of the most frequently used business processes in SAP cloud applications.

  • Informational Capabilities: Joule delivers concise responses to user inquiries made in natural language, offering helpful content summaries to assist you effectively.
  • Navigational Capabilities: It recommends relevant applications to ensure a seamless workflow, with over 500 navigation scenarios in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Transactional Capabilities: Joule provides detailed insights into business objects without needing to open specific applications, facilitating direct management of tasks with more than 45 transaction scenarios.

Activation Method: Easily activate Joule features by visiting the SAP Store.

You can self-order the free SKU through the SAP Store or contact your sales representative to place an order. Visit the SAP Store page to explore and activate Joule Base AI authorization.

For detailed steps and guidance, refer to the following resources

  1. Initial Setup
  2. Joule Onboarding Guide
  3. Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Additionally, SAP provides guided missions through the Discovery Center to help you complete Joule's configuration:

  1. Establish a Unified Joule Instance
  2. Activate Joule with SAP Cloud ERP 

 

Embedded Base AI Features

These features are seamlessly integrated into your cloud ERP modules, significantly improving operational efficiency by automating and simplifying tasks.

  • Smart Summarization: Generate intelligent summaries of business objects designed with Fiori Elements.
  • Easy Filter: Use natural language to describe the data you need and filter reports effectively, applicable across more than 1,100 reports.
  • Enterprise Search: Perform comprehensive searches using natural language.

Activation Method: To activate these features, users or partners need to register and accept SAP AI terms once, after which SAP will enable the AI features and inform you.

SAP offers comprehensive configuration and user guides for these capabilities:

  • Smart Summarization Configuration Guide and User Guide
  • Easy Filter Configuration Guide and User Guide
  • Enterprise SearchConfiguration Guide and User Guide

 

Machine Learning Base AI Features

As part of the foundational AI package, these machine learning capabilities automate and streamline specific business processes, offering significant operational benefits without any additional cost or licensing requirements.

  • Sales Order Extraction: Automatically create sales orders from unstructured data such as PDF or image format purchase orders.
  • Sales Order Auto Completion: Provide suggestions for missing data fields in sales documents to expedite the completion of sales orders and customer return orders.

Activation Method: These machine learning features are part of the embedded AI capabilities and require no extra licensing. They are included in the standard cloud subscription, offering unrestricted access.

  • Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal
  • Recommendation-Assisted Sales Order Completion | SAP Help Portal

 

Leverage the full power of SAP's AI investments by exploring and activating these features today.

With the embedded AI features, Joule's capabilities, and machine learning scenarios, you can enhance user satisfaction, boost productivity, and save time, making your business operations more efficient than ever.

For more information and a comprehensive overview of the features, please visit the following blogs:

Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Pu... - SAP Community

entry.title: AFSUG & SAP: A New Era of Support ‚Äî Join Our Executive Series and Onsite Event in Cape Town
entry.content:
AFSUG & SAP: A New Era of Support ‚Äî Join Our Executive Series and Onsite Event in Cape Town

Together with AFSUG, the African SAP User Group, SAP‚Äôs Customer Support organization is launching a series of high-impact remote sessions ‚Äî all leading up to an exclusive onsite event in Cape Town in March 2026. This program gives customers a unique opportunity to learn directly from SAP executives and experts, discover the future of support, and experience how AI, automation, and preventative practices are reshaping SAP‚Äôs entire support landscape. Whether you want to understand SAP‚Äôs proactive support strategy, get hands-on with the latest digital experiences, or explore agentic AI in real customer scenarios ‚Äî this series is built for you.

Why This Series Matters

SAP Support has evolved far beyond ‚Äúbreak/fix.‚Äù Today, it is:

  • A strategic advantage, not an insurance policy
    SAP customers choose us because we help them run better, scale smarter, and stay ahead.
  • Preventive and predictive by design
    Programs like Black Friday / Cyber Monday Readiness demonstrate how SAP reduces risk before issues arise.
  • AI-powered, human-backed
    Agentic AI, prescriptive guidance, and intelligent digital entry points give customers immediate access to insights and the right expertise.
  • Embedded across the entire lifecycle
    Support is now a built-in value multiplier ‚Äî from onboarding to transformation to continuous optimization.
  • Customer outcomes at the center
    Stability, performance, resilience, and continuous improvement aren‚Äôt extras ‚Äî they‚Äôre expectations.
  • A blueprint for operationalizing AI
    SAP Customer Support is the frontrunner in adopting agentic AI inside SAP ‚Äî and showing customers how to scale AI safely and practically in their own environments.

Join our experts as they unpack these themes in four remote sessions ‚Äî each one providing unique insights and previews of what awaits at the onsite event in Cape Town.

Remote Session Series

1. November 27, 2025 ‚Äî 3‚Äì4 PM CET / 4-5 PM SAST

From Reactive to Proactive: How SAP‚Äôs Support Strategy & Agentic AI Are Reshaping the Future

Speaker: Stefan Steinle, EVP & Head of Customer Support & Cloud Lifecycle Management, SAP SE

Support is shifting from reactive problem-solving to strategic enablement. Stefan Steinle will walk attendees through SAP‚Äôs future support strategy ‚Äî one that is predictive, preventative, and deeply infused with agentic AI.

You‚Äôll learn:

  • How SAP is moving toward proactive and preventative support models
  • How agentic AI analyzes telemetry, detects risks, and takes safe autonomous action
  • How disciplines from BF/CM Readiness are expanding into daily operations
  • A live demo on proactive support identifying ‚ÄúGo-Live endangered‚Äù situations
  • A first look at what awaits at the Cape Town onsite event ‚Äî including Support Accreditation

üëâRegister now to secure your place.

2. December 11, 2025 ‚Äî 3‚Äì4 PM CET / 4-5 PM SAST

Reinventing Support ‚Äì Self-Services, Real-Time Assistance & the Power of AI
